meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be shaken or disturbed.
meanings.sent1: She held onto the railing unshakably during the storm.
meanings.sent2: He stood unshakably strong in his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel clung unshakably to the tree branch, even when the wind blew.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was unshakably rooted in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood unshakably tall against the forces of nature.

meanings.definition: In a firm and unwavering manner.
meanings.sent1: The old tree grew unshakably in the middle of the forest.
meanings.sent2: She faced the challenge unshakably, never wavering in her resolve.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat unshakably on the windowsill, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty to his friends was unshakably steadfast.
meanings.sent5: The sun rose unshakably every morning, bringing light to the world.
